menu7.title: Corporate Governance
menu7.desc1: The 'Ko‚Äòprikqurilish' trust was established in 1968 as the 7th Bridge Construction Trust under the former USSR Ministry of Transport Construction. During the independence years, it operated as part of the 'Uzbektransqurilish' association and was incorporated into the 'Uzbekistan Railways' DATYK by the resolution No. 489 of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan on October 21, 2004.
menu7.desc2: 'Ko‚Äòprikqurilish' trust specializes in construction, maintenance, and repair of railway transport structures (bridges, tunnels, overpasses, and other artificial structures). It is the only enterprise in the republic that also has production facilities, a design organization, and a quality control laboratory for construction works.
menu7.desc3: Until 2017, the following units operated within the 'Ko‚Äòprikqurilish Trust' unitary enterprise:

presidentDecision: According to the Resolution of the President of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated October 4, 2017, No. PQ-3309, additional specialized units were established under the ‚ÄúKo‚Äòprikqurilish Trust‚Äù.
currentCompanies: Today, the following enterprises operate within the structure of the ‚ÄúKo‚Äòprikqurilish Trust‚Äù:
currentUnits: Chinoz Special Reinforced Concrete Plant LLC
reorganizationNotice: According to the Resolution No. 389/18 of the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated August 15, 2023, the ‚ÄúKo‚Äòprikqurilish‚Äù Joint-Stock Company has been reorganized.

items.text: The day-to-day activities of the company are directed by the executive body ‚Äì Company Management.
The Company Management Chairman leads management activities.
Chairman of Management - Maxamatov Zafar Ergashboyevich.
The Company Management may include the Chairman, deputies, department heads, section heads, and employees.

businessPlan.title: ‚ÄúKo‚Äòprikqurilish‚Äù JSC ‚Äì Business Plan for 2025
businessPlan.subtitle: Main directions of ‚ÄúKo‚Äòprikqurilish‚Äù JSC:
items: Construction, reconstruction, and capital repair of roads, bridges, tunnels using innovative technologies according to international standards
Submission of draft regulatory documents to sector organizations, ministries, and the Government of the Republic of Uzbekistan
Cooperation with foreign countries and international organizations
Participation in tenders (auctions), including cooperation with other enterprises (consortium, subcontract, etc.)
Determination of the value of services, products, and work provided by the company and its subsidiaries based on market conditions
businessPlan.objective: Develop a business implementation plan, improve company performance from a commercial perspective, and explore income opportunities from construction and installation work
businessPlan.additional: Also, maintain and increase market share in reinforced concrete production and services, improve labor productivity and efficiency in the company structure, and achieve planned annual revenue and profit targets

ustavKapital: The company's charter capital is 1,445,258,000 UZS (one billion four hundred forty-five million two hundred fifty-eight thousand UZS). All shares belong to the sole shareholder ‚Äì the Agency for Management of State Assets of the Republic of Uzbekistan.
